findings.rationale: The employer receives a worldwide, perpetual license to all content created, which may limit the employee's future opportunities and ownership of their work.
findings.evidence_quote: Provider grants Employer a worldwide, perpetual license to use all content and work product created during employment.

findings.rationale: Confidentiality obligations lasting 2 years after termination could restrict the employee's ability to work in the industry.
findings.evidence_quote: Confidentiality obligations survive termination and continue for 2 years.

findings.rationale: A 12-month non-compete clause may significantly hinder the employee's ability to find new employment in the same field.
findings.evidence_quote: Employee may not compete within the same market for 12 months after termination.

findings.rationale: Capping indemnification at the annual salary could expose the employee to greater liability without adequate financial protection.
findings.evidence_quote: each party indemnifies the other for its own negligence, capped at annual salary.

findings.rationale: Requiring mediation before litigation could prolong dispute resolution and increase costs for both parties.
findings.evidence_quote: Disputes shall be resolved through mediation, then litigation if mediation fails.
